newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary to sell MOL, Richter shrs in H1 '97-report.
newsitem.headline: Hungary to sell MOL, Richter shrs in H1 '97-report.

text.p: Hungary's privatisation APV plans to sell tranches of shares in drug company Richter and in oil and gas company MOL in the first half of next year, the daily Vilaggazdasag said on Thursday.
Both Richter and MOL are partially privatised.
APV declined to comment the newspaper's information.

According to the privatisation law, APV can sell further 29.33 percent in Richter, representing a face value of 5.16 billion forint, and 33 percent of MOL, with a total par value of 32.5 billion forints, Vilaggazdasag said. @
A new tranche of Richter shares is likely to be privatised around May, the newspaper said quoting unnamed sources.
Vilaggazdasag added the state planned to privatise the 33 percent stake in MOL in at least two tranches, the first of which amounting to 12 to 20 percent.
Miklos Kamaras, APV Deputy Chief Executive told Reuters recently that MOL's privatisation was likely to be continued in the first two months of next year.
